message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public classB otherElement(classB argument){
    Iterator<classB> it = setElements.iterator();
    classB first = it.next();
    classB second = it.next();
    if (first.equals(argument)){
        return second;
    } else if (second.equals(argument)){
        return first;
    }
    return null;
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an Iterator to traverse through the set. The Iterator's next method will return the next element in the set. Since you know that the set will always contain two elements, you can call next twice to get the two elements. Then, you can compare each element with the argument and return the other one if they are equal.
